text: Dear Julia Experts, I am running into memory problem with my loops. The memory demand is steadily increasing. I've found a few pages that give recommendations but my programming skills are not that great. Is there anyone who can support my with that? Thank you!

elements.text: Dear Julia Experts, I am running into memory problem with my loops. The memory demand is steadily increasing. I've found a few pages that give recommendations but my programming skills are not that great. Is there anyone who can support my with that? Thank you!

text: If you are really concerned about memory usage I would separate the loop into parts to see what is allocating and what isnt. You could check here <https://m3g.github.io/JuliaNotes.jl/stable/memory/> for some tips in how to see how.

text: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/assignment-and-mutation/19119> this thread goes into the difference between assigning and mutation

attachments.title: Assignment and mutation
attachments.text: Subtle differences between assignment and mutation in Julia as shown in the script below are easy to be missed or misunderstood by a beginner like me. I’m starting to understand and realize the importance, but still not really confident. If there’s a good (clear, plain, accurate and concise) document on the issue for beginners, I really appreciate a pointer to it. In the script below, temp(a) has an assignment, and temp1(a) a mutation. The difference is just a dot, and the results look the same...

elements.text: this thread goes into the difference between assigning and mutation
